title: 20ms ping increase did anyone figure out when this happened before?

embed.description: Two hours ago my ping was 24 now it's a static 54. It does not fluctuate and has not for the past couple of hours. I'm on Rogers Cable in Ontario Canada.

body:
my ping is usually a steady 28 within the last week or so at some point it has jumped to 45 i checked the router updated it and also bought a new modem for an increase in internet speed i now have.  I use time warner cable KNA Spectrum or charter.

Anyone else have the same issue or know where i can figure out why this happened?

replies.body:
Changes in latency, especially ones that affect multiple players from the same ISP, are typically caused by routing changes at the ISP or their network partners that directly affects how long it takes for your connection to reach our servers. I recommend running a traceroute log with [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to determine where exactly your latency starts becoming problematic. After loading up the application, simply plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After you've let the trace run for 5 or more minutes, export the results as text and paste them in a reply.

Please let me know if you run into any issues with this.
